This code chunk contains essential import statements and core components required for implementing display region management tools in a Panda3D-based application. It includes fundamental Python modules like `math`, Panda3D core classes for handling graphics, collisions, and transformations, as well as Direct-to-Panda utilities for styling and task management. The imports support the functionality of managing multiple display regions, handling mouse events, and controlling camera perspectives within a 3D scene.

import math

from panda3d.core import (
    CollisionNode,
    ConfigVariableBool,
    ConfigVariableString,
    CSDefault,
    GraphicsWindow,
    NodePath,
    Point3,
    TextNode,
    VBase3,
    VBase4,
    Vec3,
    Vec4,
    decomposeMatrix,
    deg2Rad,
)

from direct.showbase.DirectObject import DirectObject
